text.p: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu cancelled a news conference on Wednesday he had planned after his cabinet votes on the Hebron deal with the Palestinians, his spokesman said.
Spokesman Shai Bazak promised to make an announcement at the end of the meeting.
A stormy cabinet debate lasted more than 11 hours.
Bazak said he expected Defence Minister Yitzhak Mordechai and Netanyahu would make statements lasting at least another half hour.
"And so the news conference won't take place today. I will bring you an announcement to summarise the meeting," Bazak told journalists summoned for the news conference.
At least seven of Netanyahu's 18 cabinet members oppose the deal giving Palestinians self-rule in the West Bank town of Hebron.
